result.execSummary:
The defendant JERAMIAH STRIDER HETRA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
3 days credit if revoked. 
22CM1, 22CF303, & 22CF470 dismissed and read in.

miscConds.notes:
Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Absolute sobriety. 
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed. 
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Not to possess syringes unless medically required. 
Not to associate with anyone involved in illegal drug activities.

21CF554, $528
22CF214, $518
21CF554, Restitution - $3296.68 + $329.67 = $3626.36
Cash bond applied to restitution and costs. 
DNA
All seized property to be forfeited to West Central Drug Task Force. 

For each file, 3 days credit if revoked.

1:45 PM Defendant JERAMIAH STRIDER HETRA in court.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for JERAMIAH STRIDER HETRA.  Attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Yohnko enters not guilty pleas on all counts in 21CF554 and 22CF214.
Attorney Yohnk outlines plea offer. 
ADA Gay does not agree to amendment of Count 1 in 22CF214.
1:51 PM Off the record to discuss settlement proposal. 

1:56 PM On the record. Parties have joint agreement. 
State moves to amend Count 1 in 22CF214 to 961.41(1m)(e)(2), Class E Felony. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Acknowledges prior conviction(s). 
21CF554, Count 1, Repeater, Defendant enters guilty plea. 
22CF214, Amended Count 1, 2nd or Subsequent, Repeater, Defendant enters guilty plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Remaining counts and cases DRI. 
Attorney Yonko makes statement to the Court.

9:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JERAMIAH STRIDER HETRA in court.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for JERAMIAH STRIDER HETRA. 
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

9:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JERAMIAH STRIDER HETRA in court.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko appeared by phone for JERAMIAH STRIDER HETRA. 
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
